newFeaturesDialog.title: New Features
newFeaturesDialog.subTitle: Here are some of our latest features!
newFeaturesDialog.newFeature1Body: Find out who is hogging all the resources on your server and why!
newFeaturesDialog.newFeature2Body: Improved support for connecting to your MongoDB Cluster.
newFeaturesDialog.newFeature3Body: Operations that are using the most resources and tune them.
newFeaturesDialog.newFeature4Title: Open Queries in Table by Default
newFeaturesDialog.newFeature4Body: Output from queries can be shown as a table, instead of JSON
newFeaturesDialog.newFeature5Body: You can now hide the side panel and maximize any subpanel.  Toolbar and sidebar icons give quick access to common features.  And more!.

performance.title: Performance Lab
performance.unresponsive: Woops! Looks like we lost the connection. Is your Mongo server running? Please close and reopen your profile.

errors.failover: Unable to fetch metrics from server, try restarting performance lab.
errors.mongos_error: Creating Performance lab on mongos and only minimal statistics is available
errors.not_supported_storage_engine: Creating Performance lab on storage engine `{0}`. At the moment, only diagnostics on `wiredTiger` is supported

configuration.system-profile-size-warning: Changing this value will resize system profile in all selected databases and clear all existing data.

tooltip.level0: The profiler is off and does not collect any data. This is the default profiler level.
tooltip.level1: The profiler collects data for operations that take longer than the value of slowms.
tooltip.level2: The profiler collects data for all operations.
tooltip.collection-size: The system.profile collection is a capped collection with a default size of 1 megabyte.

results.noResultsFoundBody: We were unable to find any profiling data for that database.
results.noDatabaseSelectedBody: Please select a database to see profiling results.
results.noExplainBody: Select an Operation with a Plan Summary to see Explain Details.
results.noOperationSelectedBody: Select an operation to see an example query.
results.system-profile-size-warning: Changing this value will resize system profile in all selected databases and clear all existing data.

tooltip.level0: The profiler is off and does not collect any data. This is the default profiler level.
tooltip.level1: The profiler collects data for operations that take longer than the value of slowms.
tooltip.level2: The profiler collects data for all operations.
tooltip.collection-size: The system.profile collection is a capped collection with a default size of 1 megabyte.

tooltips.retry: dbKoda will try to recover from the error automatically.
tooltips.restart: dbKoda will try to recover your connection.
tooltips.run_all: Run a full aggregation pipeline without sampling.

errors.long_running: The aggregation is taking a long time to execute

aggregate_builder.no_active_connection:
dbKoda has lost connection to your Mongo Shell.
 Please close or export this aggregation and then import it or start again.
aggregate_builder.no_active_connection_for_import: Cannot import without an active connection.
aggregate_builder.import_failed: Sorry, failed to import that file!
aggregate_builder.no_valid_output:
Cannot display results at this stage, Block probably does not produce valid results.
  Pipeline stages detected as invalid will be gray.
  ----------------------------------
aggregate_builder.block_not_yet_valid:
Please fill in Stage details and click on the stage to see results.
  ----------------------------------
aggregate_builder.valid_output:
Example of Result at current Stage ({0}) 
  ----------------------------------
aggregate_builder.no_output:
No results to display at current stage in pipeline.
  Perhaps your pipeline returns no results, or is filtering out all results.
  You can also increase your sample size in the 'Start' step to increase results of accuracy.
  ----------------------------------

alerts.importWarningText: Warning, your current aggregate builder will be lost on import, please export your builder before importing a new one.
alerts.failed_message_unknown:
Apologies, Aggregation failed on that collection for an unknown reason, please raise a bug using the support bundle button in the bottom right corner of the screen.
 You can also try the button below to try and recover
alerts.failed_message: Apologies, Aggregation has lost connection with the Mongo shell, please make sure the current connection is active, restart Aggregation builder from the tree context menu, or try to automatically fix with the button below

aggregate_builder.invalid_aggregation_code: Invalid aggregation code. Please check syntax.
aggregate_builder.applyTooltip: Apply your current config to the aggregation.

telemetry_dialog.content_first: Thanks for downloading and installing dbKoda - we need your help to make it better, so we  collect statistics on product utilization so we can work out how to best invest our efforts on improving the product.
telemetry_dialog.content_second: These statistics only include information about how often various parts of the product are used and NEVER include anything personally identifiable or even anything specific to your usage of the product. We just collect feature usage counters.
telemetry_dialog.content_third: We use the Google Analytics API to collect these statistics which is used by zillions (OK, tens of millions) of websites.
telemetry_dialog.privacy_link: See our privacy policy for more details.

password_dialog.login_error_message: Not Authorized: Could not verify the password specified. Please try again
password_dialog.general_error_message: An error occurred while attempting to init the password store
password_dialog.validation_message: Please ensure your password is 8 or more characters long, and that the entered passwords both match.
password_dialog.reset_message: Due to too many failed login attempts, your password store has been reset! Please re-enable your password store and re-enter your passwords to continue using the password store feature.

tableToolbar.expandAll: Expand all Rows in the table
tableToolbar.collapseAll: Collapse all rows in the table

editor.parseJsonError: Could not parse a document from the selected text.
editor.tabularError: Unable to find a result set for that line, please right click on a JSON document
editor.exceededMaxDocs: Table View is currently limited to 500 documents at a time, please narrow your query.
editor.tableDefaultNotJson: Could not display query data in a table as JSON was not found, reverting to Raw view for this query.

explain.heading: Explain

panel.suggestIndexDescription: // INDEX ADVICE: Some of these suggestions may improve your query performance.
panel.noAdditionalIndexesRequired: // Looks good, no additional indexes are required to improve your query!
panel.addIndexCommandsPrompt: // Use these commands to implement the above indexes.
panel.executeAgain: UI has fallen out of sync, please explain query again.

step.fetchFilter: Documents from previous step were scanned looking for these criteria: {0}.
step.collScanAll: All documents in the collection where scanned. No filter condition was specified
step.collScanFilter: Documents were scanned looking for these criteria: {0}. Consider creating an index on these attributes.
step.ixscan: Index {0} was used to find matching values for {1}
step.sort: Documents were sorted on : {0}. Consider creating index on ${0} to support the sort
step.singleShard: A single shard {0} was involved in the query.
step.generateKeys: Generate keys for the next sort step
step.shardingFilter: The previous operation was sent to one or more shards
step.shardMergeSort: Output from multiple shards was merged and sorted
step.shardMerge: Output from multiple shards was merged
step.keepMutations: Merge in any documents which may have been incorrectly invalidated mid-query
step.subplan: Selected one of multiple possible plans based on $or condition
step.eof: Nothing was found: maybe collection does not exist?
step.andSorted: Output from the previous steps was sort-merged
step.sortMerge: Output from multiple index lookups were merged
step.project: A subset of columns were projected

explain.worst-shard: {0} is the most time consuming shard.

details.error: Sorry, we were unable to create the view you asked for due to the following error: {0}

config.maxOutputHistory: Maximum number of lines should be kept as output history

docker-tooltip.imageName: The Docker image used to create Mongo shell
docker-tooltip.containerId: The existing Docker container id used to create Mongo shell

remove_store_dialog.question: Are you sure you would like to disable the password store?
remove_store_dialog.qualifier: This will remove the store along with all stored passwords. These will need to be re-entered in order to connect.

tabMenu.closeLeft: Close All Tabs To The Left
tabMenu.closeRight: Close All Tabs To The Right

savingDialog.title: '{0}' has changes.
savingDialog.message: Do you want to save these changes? All changes will be lost if you close this tab without saving.

connection.createProfileError: Attempt to create a new profile failed.

profile.notClosed: Connection is not closed, editing will reset the open connection.
profile.maybeCorrupt: It seems you might have upgraded from previous version, please verify your configuration before connecting.

closeAlert.prompt: Are you sure you want to close this connection?

removeAlert.prompt: Are you sure you want to remove this connection?

openAlert.passwordPrompt: Please enter your password for this profile.
openAlert.remotePassPrompt: Please enter your password for SSH connection
openAlert.passPhrasePrompt: Please enter your passphrase for SSH connection private key
openAlert.passwordStoreInfo: Tip: To avoid seeing this prompt every time you connect, you can set up a password store in Config -> General. (The config panel can be accessed by clicking the cog icon on the left-hand navigation bar)
openAlert.passwordStoreAdd: This will add the password to your password store. You will not be asked again, but you can still change the password in the Edit Profile screen

toolbar.searchTooltip: Enter a string to search for Profiles

tree.genericValidateError: This is a generic error message!

ssl.label: SSL
ssl.tooltip: Connect to mongod or mongos using SSL

repair.label: Repair
repair.tooltip: Repair (not supported by all storage engines)

fields.label: Fields <field>[,<field>]*
fields.tooltip: Comma separated list of field names (required for exporting CSV) e.g. -f "name,age"

forceTableScan.label: forceTableScan
forceTableScan.tooltip: Perform a collection scan, not an _id index scan

assertExists.label: assertExists
assertExists.tooltip: If specified, export fails if the collection does not exist (default: false)

query.label: Query
query.tooltip: Query filter, as a JSON string, e.g., '\{x:\{$gt:1\}\}'

readPreference.label: readPreference
readPreference.tooltip: Specify either a preference name or a preference json object

dumpDbUsersAndRoles.label: dumpDbUsersAndRoles
dumpDbUsersAndRoles.tooltip: Include user and role definitions for a database dump

viewsAsCollections.label: viewsAsCollections
viewsAsCollections.tooltip: Export views as collections (eg, materialize the view)

numParallelCollections.label: numParallelCollections
numParallelCollections.tooltip: Number of parallel threads for operation

dryRun.label: dryRun
dryRun.tooltip: Don't actually import data - produce report only

writeConcern.label: writeConcern
writeConcern.tooltip: Write concern document for restore operations

keepIndexVersion.label: keepIndexVersion
keepIndexVersion.tooltip: Do not upgrade index on restore

maintainInsertionOrder.label: maintainInsertionOrder
maintainInsertionOrder.tooltip: Make sure documents are restored in the order they appear in backup

numInsertionWorkers.label: numInsertionWorkers
numInsertionWorkers.tooltip: Number of insert operations to run concurrently per collection (1 by default) (default: 1)

stopOnError.label: stopOnError
stopOnError.tooltip: Halt the restore upon any error

bypassDocumentValidation.label: bypassDocumentValidation
bypassDocumentValidation.tooltip: Do not process Document validation rules during the restore

objcheck.label: objcheck
objcheck.tooltip: Validate all documents to avoid invalid documents

oplogLimit.label: oplogLimit
oplogLimit.tooltip: Only apply oplog entries with a lesser timestamp

restoreDbUsersAndRoles.label: restoreDbUsersAndRoles
restoreDbUsersAndRoles.tooltip: Restore database user and role definitions

gzip.label: gzip
gzip.tooltip: Compress or decompress dumps using GZIP

headerLine.label: headerLine
headerLine.tooltip: Import CSV or TSV have headers in first line

ignoreBlanks.label: ignoreBlanks
ignoreBlanks.tooltip: Ignore balnk fields in input stream (don't create docs)

upsertFields.label: upsertFields
upsertFields.tooltip: List of fields that specify query (matching) portion of upsert operation

noHeaderLine.label: noHeaderLine
noHeaderLine.tooltip: Don't create header lines in exported data

feedback.alert_text: Please let us know what you think of dbKoda.

support_bundle.alert_text: Pressing okay will cause the application to bundle up some logs about your experience into a compressed file, this file can then be uploaded to the dbKoda team to help solve your bug. This may take a small amount of time.
support_bundle.finished_text_default_one: A Support Bundle has been created and is avaliable in your dbKoda directory;
support_bundle.finished_text_default_four: Please select one of the options below to send us your support bundle. See

drill.execution_failed: Failed to execute query, make sure to highlight the entire query. See Raw output tab for complete error. Please check your syntax or lodge a bug using the bottom right button.
drill.query_error: Failed to execute query, make sure to highlight the entire query. See Raw output tab for complete error. Please check your syntax or lodge a bug using the bottom right button.
drill.drill_binary_not_defined: Drill Binary not found, Please configure it in the user settings panel
drill.drill_timed_out: Timeout Error: Currently we don't support running queries which may take longer then 90 seconds.
drill.drill_large_dataset: Last query has yeilded more than 10000 rows. Only the first 10000 rows are being displayed. Kindly consider optimising your query.
drill.java_not_found: Apache Drill requires Java for execution. Please install Java and try again.
drill.drill_not_configured_message: A path to Apache Drill has not been set in the configuration panel. Would you like us to setup drill for you now? This may take some time.
drill.drill_controller_download_success: Drill Controller has been downloaded successfully.

loadWarning.warning: Warning, opening a new SQL file will overwrite your current SQL editor, please open a new Drill instance to import, or save your current SQL query first.

removeAlert.prompt: Are you sure you want to kill this operation?
